item.description:
The February meeting of the Boston MySQL User Group is going to feature a session on "Events in MySQL 5.1: The whys and whenfores" by the MySQL Community Relations Manager for North America, Duleepa "Dups" Wijayawardhana. Dups is the new Jay Pipes (Jay spoke at the user group a year or 2 ago) -- he's a knowledgeable DBA who also happens to be personable. Don't let his title throw you off to thinking he's not technical (and don't let his name bias you -- he does not have a thick accent).

From Dups: "The event scheduler is a new feature of MySQL 5.1, we will go over everything from starting up the event scheduler to a discussion of its uses, some examples (simple and complex, real-life and abstract) and finally when and why you should use it."

He will also be available for any questions you have. Because of this special guest, we are MOVING the date to WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 4TH, and the venue has changed -- we're still at MIT, but we're in E40, room 298 (second floor). E40 is the red brick bldg connected via the 3rd floor glass bridge way from where we usually meet in E51. E40 is closer to the T station. http://whereis.mit.ed...


------------------------

Here is the URL for MIT's Map with the location of this building:
http://whereis.mit.ed...

This map shows the MBTA Kendall Stop:
http://whereis.mit.ed...
(the stop is in red on that map, and you can see E51 in the bottom right)

Here are the URL's for the parking lots:
http://whereis.mit.ed...
http://whereis.mit.ed...

Free pizza and soda will be served, so please RSVP accurately.

To RSVP anonymously, please login to the Meetup site with the e-mail address "admin at sheeri dot com" and the password "guest".

For more information, see: http://mysql.meetup.c...
item.name: DATE/LOCATION CHANGE: The Boston MySQL February Meetup
